tuv.seg: "Ah, good morning, Little Red Riding Hood," said the wolf.
“Ꭰ, ᎣᏍᏓ ᎬᎪᏩᏘᎭ, ᎤᏍᏗ ᎩᎦᎨ ᎠᎵᏍᏚᎶ,” ᎤᏛᏁ Ꮎ ᏩᏯ.
"Are you afraid to go?" said her mother.
"Can it be the wolf?" said one kid.
"Come to the bedside," said the wolf.
"Come, so that I can see you.
"Did you let the wolf in?" said the goat.
"Don't you hear me?" called the wolf again.
"Good-morning, grandmother," said Little Red Riding Hood.
“ᎣᏍᏓ ᎬᎪᏩᏘᎭ, ᎡᎵᏏ,” ᎤᏛᏁ ᎤᏍᏗ ᎩᎦᎨ ᎠᎵᏍᏚᎶ.
"Goodbye, Little Red Riding Hood," said the wolf.
“ᏙᎾᏓᎪᎲᎢ, ᎤᏍᏗ ᎩᎦᎨ ᎠᎵᏍᏚᎶ,” ᎤᏛᏁ Ꮎ ᏩᏯ.
"Here I am," said Little Red Riding Hood.
"Here are some cakes, Little Red Riding Hood.
“ᎠᎭᏂ ᎢᎦᏓ ᎦᏚ ᎤᏂᎦᎾᏍᏓ, ᎤᏍᏗ ᎩᎦᎨ ᎠᎵᏍᏚᎶ.
"His voice is so soft," said another.
"How did he know where grandmother lived?"
"How did he know where you were going?"
"How did the wolf know you?" said Little Red Riding Hood's mother.
“ᎦᏙ ᏦᏟᏍᏗ ᎨᏎ?” ᎤᏛᏁ ᎤᏥ ᎤᏍᏗ ᎩᎦᎨ ᎠᎵᏍᏚᎶ.
"How do you do, grandmother?" said the wolf.
“ᎦᏙ ᎣᏍᏓ ᎭᏛᏁᎭ, ᎡᎵᏏ?” ᎤᏛᏁ Ꮎ ᏩᏯ.
"I am going to see my grandmother."
"I am here," cried the kid in the clock.
“ᎠᏴ ᎠᎭᏂ,” ᎤᏠᏱᎴ Ꮎ ᎤᎦᏐᏣᏁᏓ ᎠᎩᎾ ᎤᏣᎥᎢ ᎡᏆ ᏩᏥᏱ.
"I am so glad," said the goat.
"I ate the kids, to be sure.
"I do not wish to see you.
"I have brought you some cakes and butter," said the wolf.
“ᎢᎦᏓ ᎦᏚ ᎤᏂᎦᎾᏍᏓ ᎠᎴ ᎪᏢᏅᎢ ᏕᏥᏲᎦ,” ᎤᏛᏁ Ꮎ ᏩᏯ.
"I have had a good sleep," he said.
"I like to go to see grandmother."
"I like to walk in the forest.
"I must be going away now," said the wolf.
"I must eat that little girl," said the wolf.
“Ꮎ ᎤᏍᏗ ᎠᎨᏳᏣ ᎠᏎ ᏥᏒᎲᏍᏗ,” ᎤᏓᏅᏖᏞ Ꮎ ᏩᏯ.
"I must eat those kids," said the wolf.
“ᎥᏍᎩ ᎤᎾᎦᏐᏣᏁᏓ ᎠᏂᎩᎾ ᎠᏎ ᎦᏥᏒᎲᏍᏗ,” ᎤᏛᏁ Ꮎ ᏩᏯ.
"I shall have to change my voice," he said.
"I shall see you again," said the wolf.
"I shall wait for Little Red Riding Hood.
"I told him my name," said Little Red Riding Hood.
"I told him where I was going."
"I was so afraid he would swallow you, too!" she cried.
"I will eat this little girl," thought he.
"I will go to the miller and get some flour.
"I will go," said Little Red Riding Hood.
"I wonder where he is going," said Little Red Riding Hood.
"Is your grandmother ill?" said the wolf.
"It is I, Little Red Riding Hood."
"It is Red Riding Hood," said the wolf.
"Let me in, dear little kids," said the wolf.
“ᎠᎩᏴᏍᏗ, ᏗᏆᏤᎵ ᏧᎾᏍᏗ ᎤᎾᎦᏐᏣᏁᏓ ᎠᏂᎩᎾ,” ᎤᏛᏁ Ꮎ ᏩᏯ.
"Let me in, grandmother," said Little Red Riding Hood.
"Let us see your feet, I say," cried the oldest kid.
"Let us see your feet," they said.
"Little Red Riding Hood will soon be here.
"Mother Goat is going to get food.
"No, I am not hurt," said Little Red Riding Hood.
“ᎥᏝ ᎤᏲ ᏯᏆᎵᏍᏓᏁᎭ,” ᎤᏛᏁ ᎤᏍᏗ ᎩᎦᎨ ᎠᎵᏍᏚᎶ.
"No, I never will," said Little Red Riding Hood.
“ᎥᏝ ᎢᎸᎯᏳ ᏩᏯ ᏱᏘᏯᎵᏃᎮᏔᏂ,” ᎤᏛᏁ ᎤᏍᏗ ᎩᎦᎨ ᎠᎵᏍᏚᎶ.
"No, we will not," said the kids.
"Now I have eaten all the kids," he said.
"Now I must get into bed," he said.
"Now, I will get my kids again," said the goat.
"O my dear kids; my dear kids!" cried the goat.
“Ꭳ ᎢᏨᏳᎭ ᏗᏇᏥ; ᎢᏨᏳᎭ ᏗᏇᏥ!” ᎤᏠᏱᎴ ᎤᏂᏥ ᎤᎦᏐᏣᏁᏓ.
"O no, I am not afraid," said Little Red Riding Hood.
“Ꭳ, ᎥᏝ, ᎾᎩᏍᎦᎸᎾ,” ᎤᏛᏁ ᎤᏍᏗ ᎩᎦᎨ ᎠᎵᏍᏚᎶ.
"O no, we will not let you in," said the kids.
“Ꭳ Ꮭ, Ꮭ ᏱᎦᏣᏴᏍᏗ,” ᎤᎾᏛᏁ ᎤᎾᎦᏐᏣᏁᏓ ᎠᏂᎩᎾ.
"O, I am afraid!" said Little Red Riding Hood.
"O, I am glad you have come!" said the wolf.
"O, I am glad you have come," said the grandmother.
"O, I am so heavy!" he said.
"O, I am so sorry!" said Little Red Riding Hood.
“Ꭳ, ᏙᏳ ᎤᏲ!” ᎤᏛᏁ ᎤᏍᏗ ᎩᎦᎨ ᎠᎵᏍᏚᎶ.
“Ꭳ, ᏗᏇᏥ ᎤᎾᎦᏐᏣᏁᏓ ᎠᏂᎩᎾ!” ᎤᏠᏱᎴ ᎤᏥ ᎤᎦᏐᏣᏁᏓ.
"O, there you are!" cried the wood choppers.
“Ꭳ, ᎯᎠ ᏭᎪᏛ ᏗᏂᎨᏓ ᎤᎾᎦᏐᏣᏁᏓ ᎠᏂᎩᎾ!” ᎤᏠᏱᎴ.
"O, you bad, bad wolf!" said the grandmother.
"O, you silly, silly Little Red Riding Hood!
"Open the door, little kids," he called.
"Put on your little red hood, Little Red Riding Hood.
“ᏣᏤᎵ ᎩᎦᎨ ᎠᎵᏍᏚᎶ ᎭᎵᏍᏚᎸᎦ, ᎤᏍᏗ ᎩᎦᎨ ᎠᎵᏍᏚᎶ.
"See how they can hug you, Little Red Riding Hood.
“ᎯᎪᏩᏔ ᎥᏍᎩ ᎣᏍᏓ ᎨᏣᏄᎩᏣᏗ, ᎤᏍᏗ ᎩᎦᎨ ᎠᎵᏍᏚᎶ.
"Shall you know the wolf when he comes?" said Mother Goat.
“ᏓᏣᏅᏘᏍᎪ Ꮎ ᏩᏯ ᎤᎷᏨᎢ?” ᎤᏛᏛᏅ ᎤᏂᏥ ᎤᎦᏐᏣᏁᏓ..
"She lives on the edge of the forest."
"The voice is soft," said one kid.
"The voice is soft," said the kids.
“Ꮎ ᏭᎪᏛ ᎤᏲ ᏩᏯ!” ᎤᏛᏁ ᎤᏥ ᎤᎦᏐᏣᏁᏓ.
"The wolf ate my six little kids.
“ᏗᏇᏥ ᏑᏓᎵ ᎤᏍᏗ ᎤᎾᎦᏐᏣᏁᏓ ᎠᏂᎩᎾ ᏚᏒᏁ Ꮎ ᏩᏯ.
"The wolf ate them," said the kid.
“Ꮎ ᏩᏯ ᎥᏍᎩ ᏚᏒᏅᎩ,” ᎤᏛᏁ ᎤᎦᏐᏣᏁᏓ ᎠᎩᎾ.
"The wolf has black feet, too," said the goat.
"Then I can eat you all the better."
"Then I can see you all the better," said the wolf.
"Then I will go again to the kids."
"There is the wolf!" said the kid.
"These are strong arms," said the wolf.
"These arms look so strange," said Little Red Riding Hood.
"They do not look like your arms, grandmother.
"They will kill me," said the wolf.
"Those kids are very wise," he said.
"We are all glad," said the Mother Goat.
"We are so glad!" said the kids.
"We have been trying to catch him for a long time.
"We will not let the wolf in," said the kids.
“Ꮎ ᏩᏯ ᎥᏝ ᎤᏴᏍᏗ ᏱᏓᏲᏣᎵᏍᎪᎸᏓᏁᎵ,” ᎤᎾᏛᏁ ᎤᎾᎦᏐᏣᏁᏓ ᎠᏂᎩᎾ.
"We will not open the door for any wolf."
"We will take Little Red Riding Hood home to her mother," said the wood cutters."
ᎤᏍᏗ ᎩᎦᎨ ᎠᎵᏍᏚᎶ ᏓᏲᏥᎾᏫᏛᎯ ᎤᏥ ᎦᎵᏦᏕ,” ᎤᎾᏛᏁ Ꮎ ᏗᏂᎴᏴᏍᏗᏍᎩ.
"Well, look at my feet," said the wolf.
"What have you in the basket?" said the wolf.
“ᎦᏙ ᏧᏍᏗ ᏔᎷᏣ ᎤᎾᏣᎠ?” ᎤᏛᏁ Ꮎ ᏩᏯ.
"What is that noise?" said the wood choppers.
"What, not let your mother in?" cried the wolf.
“ᎦᏙ, ᎢᏨᏥ ᎥᏝ ᎠᎩᏴᏍᏗ ᏱᏣᎵᏍᎪᎸᏓᏁᎭ?” ᎤᏠᏱᎸᎢ ᎤᏛᏁ Ꮎ ᏩᏯ.
"Where are the other kids?" said the Mother Goat.
“ᎭᏢ ᏗᏐᎢ ᎤᎾᎦᏐᏣᏁᏓ ᎠᏂᎩᎾ?” ᎤᏛᏁ ᎤᏥ ᎤᎦᏐᏣᏁᏓ.
"Where are you going?" said the wolf.
"Where does she live?" asked the wolf.
"Who is it?" said the sick grandmother.
"Why do the wood choppers bring you home?
"Why do you not open the door?"
"Why, don't you know me?" said the wolf.
"Why, how heavy I am!" said the wolf.
“ᎦᏙ ᏃᏊ? ᏭᎪᏛ ᏥᎨᏓ!” ᎤᏛᏁ Ꮎ ᏩᏯ.
"Yes, I am afraid of your eyes," said Little Red Riding Hood.
“ᎥᎥ, ᏘᎦᏙᎵ ᏕᏥᏍᎦᎭ,” ᎤᏛᏁ ᎤᏍᏗ ᎩᎦᎨ ᎠᎵᏍᏚᎶ.
"Yes, let me go," said Little Red Riding Hood.
"Yes, she is ill," said Little Red Riding Hood.
"Yes, we let the wolf in," said the kid.
“ᎥᎥ, ᏩᏯ ᎤᏴᏍᏗ ᏃᎦᏛᏁᎸᎩ,” ᎤᏛᏁ ᎤᎦᏐᏣᏁᏓ ᎠᎩᎾ.
"You are not our mother," said the kids.
"You are not the Mother Goat," said the kids.
“ᏂᎯ ᎥᏝ ᎣᏥᏥ ᎤᎦᏐᏣᏁᏓ ᏱᎩ,” ᎤᎾᏛᏁ ᎤᎾᎦᏐᏣᏁᏓ ᎠᏂᎩᎾ.
"You look so strange!" said Little Red Riding Hood.
“ᎬᎦᏙᏍᏗ ᎠᎴ ᎯᏎᎩ!” ᎤᏛᏁ Ꮎ ᎤᏍᏗ ᎩᎦᎨ ᎠᎵᏍᏚᎶ.
"You must first let us see your feet."
"You need not cry for help," said the wolf.
“ᎩᎶ ᎢᏥᏍᏕᎸᏗ ᎢᏥᏯᏅᏗ ᏂᏥᎬᏨᎾ,” ᎤᏛᏁ Ꮎ ᏩᏯ.
"You were a bad wolf to eat my kids," said the goat.
“ᏂᎯ ᏭᎪᏛ ᎤᏲᎢ ᏩᏯ ᎨᏎ ᎦᎯᏒᏅᎢ ᏗᏇᏥ Ꮎ ᎤᎾᎦᏐᏣᏁᏓ ᎠᏂᎩᎾ,” ᎤᏛᏁ ᎤᏂᏥ ᎤᎦᏐᏣᏁᏓ.
And I will get my kids back."
And grandmother jumped out of his mouth.
And he was a bad, bad wolf!
But I can hear you all the better, Little Red Riding Hood."

But I wonder what she has in the basket."
But Little Red Riding Hood is not afraid.
But Little Red Riding Hood was afraid.
But are the kids as heavy as this?"
But he fell head first into the spring.
But you will not get into my house again.
By and by the Mother Goat came.
By and by the wolf awoke.
By and by, the goat and the one kid went out for a walk.

Come here and let me hug you.
Come to me, Little Red Riding Hood," she said.

Come, Little Red Riding Hood, come!"
Come, so that I can hear you.
Come, so that I can hug you.

Do not open the door when you hear the rough voice."
ᎤᏓᏣᎧᏗ ᎤᏁᏨᎢ ᏱᎩ ᏞᏍᏗ ᎦᎶᎯᏍᏗᎢ ᏥᏥᏍᏚᎢ.”
For they saw that they had let in the wolf.
ᎤᏲ ᏣᎵᏍᏓᏏ, ᏂᎯ Ꮎ ᏭᎪᏛ ᎤᏲ ᏩᏯ.
Grandmother lives on the other edge.
He could not walk very well.
He dragged himself down to the spring.
He has on her cap, too.
He heard what she said to the kids.
He is wearing a hat, is wearing a coat, and is wearing shoes.
He said he would eat me.
He told us to open the door.

Help me out!" cried the wolf.

Her mother has just sent her.

Ꮎ ᎤᏲ ᏩᏯ,” ᎤᏛᏁ ᏌᏊ ᎦᎴᏴᏍᏗᏍᎩ.

Little Red Riding Hood loves her.

Little Red Riding Hood went in.
